docs.snippet: A fan of the Swedish pop group ABBA saw the money, money, money roll in as his collection of more than 25,000 ABBA albums, posters and other memorabilia was sold at an auction house in Stockholm, the company said Monday....

docs.snippet: A man suspected of abducting a 16-year-old family friend after killing her mother and younger brother died in a shootout with FBI agents exactly 15 years after his father committed suicide, a family spokesman said Monday....

docs.snippet: Horse racing’s most influential group released results of a poll showing that drugs and integrity concerns loom larger to bettors than any other issue facing the sport....
docs.lead_paragraph: Horse racing’s most influential group released results of a poll showing that drugs and integrity concerns loom larger to bettors than any other issue facing the sport.
docs.abstract: Jockey Club, horse racing’s most influential group, will pay up to $500,000 for out-of-competition drug testing over the next two years; warns horsemen, regulators and racetracks that doping and cheating will decimate sport’s bottom line unless complete national reform begins immediately.

headline.main: As Concerns Over Drugs Mount, the Jockey Club Says It Will Pay for Testing
headline.print_headline: As Concerns Over Drugs Mount, the Jockey Club Says It Will Pay for Testing
